byline.original: By GREG BISHOP and TIMOTHY WILLIAMS
byline.contributor: Greg Bishop reported from Zanesville, Ohio, and Timothy Williams from New York. Leslie Kaufman and J. David Goodman contributed reporting from New York. and Barclay Walsh contributed research.

abstract: Zanesville, Ohio, authorities hunt down and kill or capture 56 exotic animals, which had escaped or been released from a private reserve owned by animal collector Terry Thompson; Thompson is found dead from an apparent self-inflicted gunshot wound on his property.
snippet: The release, and then death or capture, of exotic animals set off tense watches, frantic searches and a news media tumult.
lead_paragraph: The release, and then death or capture, of exotic animals set off tense watches, frantic searches and a news media tumult.

headline.main: Police Kill Dozens of Animals Freed on Ohio Reserve
headline.print_headline: Ohio as Veld: Wild Animals Hunted Down
headline.seo: Dozens of Animals Killed After Being Freed at Zanesville, Ohio, Reserve
